A sender factory that returns a sender that reaches into a receiverâ€™s environment and pulls out the current value associated with a given [[cpp/execution#Queries|query object]].

For any query object {{tt|q}}, the expression {{c|read_env(q)}} is [[cpp/language/expressions#Expression-equivalence|expression-equivalent]] to {{c|/*make-sender*/(read_env, q)}}.

{{cpp/execution/cpo|tag=no}}

===Example===
An example usage of this factory is to schedule dependent work on the receiver's scheduler, which can be obtained with {{c|read_env(get_scheduler)}}:
{{source|1=
std::execution::sender auto task =
  std::execution::read_env(std::execution::get_scheduler)
    {{!}} std::execution::let_value([](auto sched) {
        return std::execution::starts_on(sched, /*some nested work here*/);
    });

std::this_thread::sync_wait( std::move(task) ); // wait for it to finish
}}
